definition: to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: I tried to change it but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我努力改變這種狀況，但勞而無功。

sentences.english: However, Grunger's immense armada caused the campaign to end in failure.
sentences.chinese: 但格魯吉爾的龐大艦隊使得塔科發動的戰役勞而無功。

sentences.english: They tried to rally the pound sterling but in vain.
sentences.chinese: 他們企圖恢復英鎊幣值，但勞而無功。

sentences.english: She tried to prevent the work from being done in vain .
sentences.chinese: 她試圖防止工作做得勞而無功。

sentences.english: Gates had some reason to think Jobs' mission was worthless.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨是有理由認爲喬布斯會勞而無功的。

sentences.english: Billions of dollars have been spent on long-range weather forecasting, but it is a fool's errand.
sentences.chinese: 數十億美元花在遠程氣象預報上是一個勞而無功的事。
